wikipedia_page.main: John Joy Bell (7 June 1871 – 14 November 1934), known professionally as J.J. Bell, was a Scottish journalist and author.

response: * John Joy Bell, journalist and author
* 14 November – John Joy Bell, writer, creator of Wee Macgreegor (born 1871)

Beyond London Lights is a lost The Library of Congress/FIAF American Silent Feature Film Survival Catalog: Beyond London Lights 1928 American silent drama film directed by Tom Terriss and starring Adrienne Dore, Lee Shumway, and Bill Elliott. It is based on John Joy Bell's 1917 novel Kitty Carstairs, and is sometimes referred to by that title.Goble p.688 It was made by Film Booking Offices of America. The AFI Catalogo of Feature Films: Beyond London Lights
Kitty Carstairs is a 1917 novel by the British writer John Joy Bell. It was adapted into a 1928 American silent film Beyond London Lights starring Adrienne Dore.Goble p.688
*John Joy Bell (18711934), a prolific Scottish writer and journalist, best remimbered for his comic fictional creation, Wee Macgreegor.
